title: 103_hr634
content: Payment of benefits for the month of recipient's death. Amendments include modifications related to parent's death, marriage, disability insurance benefits, and benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, including changes in the month of recipient's death payment. The last payment of monthly insurance benefit terminated by death results in a 50 percent reduction for the month of death, payable to the surviving spouse. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, including changes in the month of recipient's death payment. If an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly benefit will be reduced by 50 percent for that month and paid to the surviving spouse. The amendment to the Social Security Act reduces the monthly insurance benefit by 50 percent if an individual dies in the first 15 days of a month. The reduced benefit is payable to the surviving spouse. This change applies to deaths occurring after 180 days from the enactment of the Act.
